chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall p n x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) p -> divides x p

Premises:
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
prime_square : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> divides (square a) p -> divides a p
prime_mult : forall p a b : nat, is_prime p -> divides (a * b) p -> divides a p \/ divides b p
prime_div_gcd : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ divides a p -> rel_prime p a
prime_rel_prime : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ rel_prime a p -> divides a p
power_divides_power : forall x n m : nat, x > 1 -> divides (power x n) (power x m) -> m <= n
power_divides_lemma1 : forall n x : nat, 0 < n -> divides (power x n) x
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
prime_gcd : forall d p a : nat, is_prime p -> is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p
mult_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> n * p < m * p
Nat.lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
mult_le_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n * p <= m * p
Nat.mul_le_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
Nat.sub_le_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> n - p <= m - p
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
power_power_lemma1 : forall n m x : nat, power (power x n) m = power x (n * m)
Nat.mul_sub_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n - m) * p = n * p - m * p
Nat.mul_add_distr_r : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) * p = n * p + m * p
Nat.mul_sub_distr_l : forall n m p : nat, p * (n - m) = p * n - p * m
Nat.le_sub_le_add_r : forall n m p : nat, n - p <= m < -> n <= m + p
Nat.lt_add_lt_sub_l : forall n m p : nat, n + p < m < -> p < m - n
Nat.Bezout = fun n m p : nat => exists a b : nat, a * n = p + b * m : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Bezout (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Ndigits.Pshiftl_nat_N : forall (p : positive) (n : nat), N.pos (Pos.shiftl_nat p n) = N.shiftl_nat (N.pos p) n
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p
Nat.add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n + (m + p) = n + m + p
BinPosDef.Pos.shiftl_nat = fun p : positive => nat_rect (fun _ : nat => positive) p (fun _ : nat => xO) : positive -> forall n : nat, (fun _ : nat => positive) n Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.shiftl_nat _%positive_scope _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
fast_Zplus_assoc : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (n + m + p)%Z -> P (n + (m + p))%Z
fast_Zplus_permute : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (m + (n + p))%Z -> P (n + (m + p))%Z

```coq
intros p n x H1 H2.
apply is_prime_square with (a := x); auto.
Qed.```
